title: How late was the most overdue library book you ever borrowed? - Quora

response.answer_text: Several months. I moved to a new home and lost the book in the course of moving. My new home was in the same library’s service area. I got a notice in the mail forwarded from my old address. I took the notice to the library along with a utility bill for proof of my new address. I explained the situation, paid for the value of the book and got my address updated in the library’s records. I felt awful about it, but it was probably one of the better interactions that library worker had with a patron that day. Somebody owning up to a mistake, accepting the penalty without complaint and thinking ahead to bring along proof of a new address doesn’t happen all that often. It wasn’t until years later that I found the book, but I did make things right with the library when I paid for its value, so I would count that as being months late, not years. Thanks for asking me to answer.

When my son was in elementary school, he borrowed a book and never returned it! Months later (or maybe years later) I found it while I was cleaning his room. So, on a Sunday, on my way to church, I dropped that book in the overnight slot at our Public Library.
